column4: Vhuck_Norris, I don't want to upgrade now, so how can I fix this problem without doing so?
have you tried this?: http://askubuntu.com/questions/58928/update-manager-says-not-all-updates-can-be-installed
I tried following those instructions, I ended up where I unintentionally removed VLC. But I want VLC, its the only video player I have that runs commercial DVDs decently
did you manage to install everything else?
I guess so
well, then just reinstall the vlc.
Should I do it through software center, or what?
software center, synaptic, apt-get install vlc... all of them should work
should not. I'm not sure, but afaik both synaptic and software center are just guis for apt-get
guis is graphical front end, like GUI but a different software design or something?
if something is gui for something else, the gui uses the same code as the underlying thing to do the task. gui just adds the visual part
in this case, there might be further differences, but it is very unlikely that any problems would occur using any of these programs
guis is just plural of gui
when I try to install VLC, I get the following errors http://i46.tinypic.com/15c45u.png
it's probably the vlc daily build ppa. the vlc there seems to require newer libraries than natty can provide
did you try to install  vlc from main repository?
How do i do that?
I dont use software center, but at the moment you seem to have selected VLC Daily Build ppa. Try selectin Get Software -> Sound and Video
where is this "get software"?
just below the File Edit View Help
in the software center?
